WorkItem.Description:
I'm a tree.  I run 10 man raids, and our second healer is a shammy. I often benefit from my own Revitalize and the shammy's mana tide totem, but I see no way to tell Rawr to take that into account.  I do not run with a priest, but it's pretty much the same thing so I thought I'd throw Hymn of Hope into the title as well.  Maybe there are other give-your-raid-mana abilities, too, besides replenishment?  
Â 
Suggestion for fix:
Add those to the buffs for all the classes/specs.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.Buffs] Revitalize, Mana Tide, Hymn of Hope

Comments.Message: Which model are you needing this in? Some models handle that in a different way than the buff selector

I use the tree, elemental & resto shammy, all 3 pally, hunter and warlock models.  What can I say - I like alts.

My top priority is tree, and it is the model I'm most familiar with in Rawr.
Hymn of Hope and Mana Tide have been added, the models will need to verify how it's affecting them. Revitalize will be a little more complicated and I'm holding off on it.

Interesting tidbit: if you have rejuvenation and wild growth rolling on you, Revitalize will average 12 procs = 12% mana per minute.  That's 1% mp5.  That gives me 240 mp5, which is pretty significant.  If Wild Growth is up 50% on you (which is about right for a 10 man raid & a druid who likes to use it), that drops to .625% mp5, 150 mp5 for me.  Still nothing to scoff at.

Let see - w/ RJ rolling & 50% WG uptime, that's .5 rage/sec, 1 energy/sec, or 2 runic power/sec.

Here's the Chart of what mana models use which buffs:
Note: Some models have Percentage sliders for Replenishment uptime as well as other variables				

R = Replenishment (Hunting Party, Judgements of the Wise, Vampiric Touch, Improved Soul Leech, Enduring Winter)
M = Mana Regeneration (Mana Spring Totem, Blessing of Wisdom)
B = Burst Mana Regeneration (Hymn of Hope, Mana Tide Totem)
S = Mana Restore (Judgement of Wisdom)
5 = Mp5 Food
P = Mana Pots/Injectors

Results:
X = Has it, shows value
? = Has it, doesn't show value
_ = Doesn't have it
O = There is an option panel version in use

R	|	M	|	B	|	S	|	5	|	P	|	Model
===============================
X	|	X	|	?	|	X	|	X	|	?	|	Moonkin
X	|	X	|	X	|	_	|	X	|	X	|	Tree
X	|	X	|	X	|	X	|	X	|	X	|	Hunter
X	|	X	|	O	|	X	|	X	|	O	|	Mage
X	|	X	|	X	|	_	|	X	|	X	|	Healadin
_	|	_	|	_	|	_	|	_	|	_	|	Retribution
_	|	_	|	_	|	_	|	X	|	_	|	ProtPaladin
X	|	X	|	X	|	_	|	X	|	?O	|	HolyPriest
_	|	X	|	_	|	?O	|	X	|	?O	|	Shadow
X	|	X	|	?	|	X	|	X	|	?	|	Elemental
?	|	?	|	?	|	?	|	?	|	_	|	Enhance
X	|	X	|	X	|	_	|	X	|	X	|	RestoSham
X	|	X	|	X	|	?	|	X	|	X	|	Warlock

What would you like to see? All X's on this board? For uniformity's sake I would want that but there is some need for specifics in certain models, which is why they have O's. So if it's an X or O it's ok, but _ or ? needs to change.

Shadow does have replenishment, but its implied if you have Vampiric Touch.
ShadowPriest model does not use Hymn of Hope because I do not model self sacrificing DPS for raid benefit. I could add support for other Priests casting it, but I will have to think about that for next version.
This issue is not relevant for Shadow/HolyPriest models.
Working correctly in Resto sham, as well as adding in a tooltip to warn that you should only check the mana tide buff in the buff pane if there is a second shaman.
